file_content.text: I will be on Taris for some time to come. There are many buildings in fragile condition, all of which must be studied.
I can smell chemicals on you. But I also smell fire and smoke.
Did you complete the burnoff? All the toxins and pollutants have been incinerated?
Absolutely.
Just barely.
Nothing could please me more. Thank you.
Don't know why I bothered.
A pity you perceive it this way. I believe you have saved lives.
The structure will still collapse, but it shall leave no poison in its wake. Perhaps we can rebuild the area after all.
If there is any way you can destroy the chemicals before their storage building collapses, please--assist us.
What do you think, Kon?
The foundation of the Taris ChemWorks Factory cannot be repaired. I expect total collapse within two weeks.
Once the building falls, the stored chemicals will flood this area. They are... highly toxic to humans. I am sorry.
I'll make sure there are speeders on hand, but we can't just pack up and go. Do what you can.
As always. I will pursue an alternative.
Master Jedi, forgive my inattentiveness. I'm honored by your presence, though I advise you not to stay long.
Forgive me, officer--I am aware of your presence, and duly respectful. However, I advise you not to stay long.
Excuse my inattentiveness, mistress--you are with the reconstruction effort? I must advise you not to stay long.
Excuse my inattentiveness, master--you are with the reconstruction effort? I advise you not to stay long.
You were talking about evacuation. What's going on?
I overheard that call....
I appreciate the advice, but I could use a reason.
Why shouldn't I stay?
I don't need advice.
Again, I apologize. Perhaps I can approach this matter differently.
Many of these ruins are unstable. A nearby structure used for chemical storage is on the verge of crumbling.
As I was explaining to my colleague, there is only one way to remove the chemicals before they spill--a burnoff.
A well-armed demolitions team could reach the structure and incinerate the chemical stockpiles. I can provide the incendiaries; unfortunately, no team is available.
You want to plant explosives around a building that's about to collapse?
Sounds dangerous.
I'm willing to try.
Your generosity is considerable. You should know, however:
I wouldn't worry. It can't get much worse than this.
This whole planet's toxic.
You are--apologies--mistaken. These chemicals are known to cause at least seventeen distinct illnesses.
Between the structural instability, the toxicity levels and the incendiary chemicals, the mission does carry substantial risk. It is nonetheless urgent.
You are not a demolitions team--I fully recognize this. But if you could arrange the burnoff, I would humbly welcome your aid.
Please excuse me. I am studying the latest engineering survey of the ruins....
